item.title: Landau Damping
item.description: arXiv:2510.15417v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Landau damping is a key mechanism to preserve the stability of particle beams under the influence of various collective forces that would otherwise spoil its quality through beam instabilities. We describe its root cause as well as ways to control it in order to design and operate particle accelerators.
item.dc:creator: Xavier Buffat

item.title: Compensating for Amplifier Non-Linearity in a SEL Controller
item.description: arXiv:2510.15813v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The Self-Excited Loop (SEL) architecture, used in some continuous-wave (CW) superconducting linacs, relies on a positive feedback mechanism that requires carefully defined operating limits to ensure stable operation. These limits are typically derived from amplifier calibration, which characterizes the relationship between forward power and DAC drive. However, amplifier non-linearity often prevents a simple linear fit of this characteristic, introducing errors that can compromise stability. To address this, we present a modified calibration procedure that incorporates amplifier non-linearity into the SEL framework. The approach is validated with test data from a 32 kW solid-state amplifier (SSA) and a cavity emulator developed for the Fermilab PIP-II linac.
item.dc:creator: S. Raman (Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory), P. Varghese (Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory), L. Reyes (Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory), M. Guran (Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory), L. Doolittle (Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory), S. Murthy (Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory), Q. Du (Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory)

item.title: The Coming of Age of the Ultracold Electron Source: A Review
item.description: arXiv:2510.09889v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The ultracold electron source is a unique approach to the generation of high-brightness electron beams. We give an overview of its development over the past 20 years, including the underlying physical principles, technical details and recent experiments, and give a flavor of the exciting prospects that the future may hold.
item.dc:creator: Julius Huijts, Jom Luiten
